intro: Psephellus sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenisi's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to arid and saline conditions. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
